segments.text: John , do you have a minute ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , hi , Leo . Sure , what ’ s up ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I ’ Ve been meaning to talk to you about the situation in the office .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m not in there very often . It ’ s so noisy that I can ’ t work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s exactly what I ’ m getting at . We ’ re supposed to be able to do our preparation and marking in that office , but have you noticed ? Jack constantly has students coming in to get help with his course . A lot people are going in and out .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Has anybody spoken to him about it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , not yet , but someone ’ s going to have to .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We can ’ t really ask him to stop having students come in for help , can we ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , of course not . But I ’ m not able to do my work and neither are you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How about recommending him to use the storage room down the hall ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , that would be too small .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: With the cabinets taken out , it might be bigger than it looks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Come to think of it , you may be on to something . Let ’ s go have a look .
segments.speaker: S1
